definitions.definition: To look at and interpret letters or other information that is written.
To speak aloud words or other information that is written. Often construed with a to phrase or an indirect object.
synonyms: read aloud, read out, read out loud, speak
definitions.example: All right, class, who wants to read next?

definitions.definition: To read work(s) written by (a named author).
definitions.example: At the moment I'm reading Milton.

definitions.definition: To interpret, or infer a meaning, significance, thought, intention, etc. from.
definitions.example: I can read his feelings in his face.

definitions.definition: To consist of certain text.
definitions.example: On the door hung a sign that reads "No admittance".

definitions.definition: Of text, etc., to be interpreted or read in a particular way.
To substitute (a corrected piece of text in place of an erroneous one); used to introduce an emendation of a text.
(usually ironic) Used after a euphemism to introduce the intended, more blunt meaning of a term.
To be able to hear what another person is saying over a radio connection.
To observe and comprehend (a displayed signal)
definitions.example: A repeater signal may be used where the track geometry makes the main signal difficult to read from a distance.

definitions.definition: (except Scotland) To make a special study of, as by perusing textbooks.
definitions.example: I am reading theology at university.

definitions.definition: To fetch data from (a storage medium, etc.).
definitions.example: to read a hard disk; to read a port; to read the keyboard

definitions.definition: To think, believe; to consider (that).
To advise; to counsel. See rede.
To tell; to declare; to recite.
To recognise (someone) as being transgender.
definitions.example: Every time I go outside, I worry that someone will read me.

definitions.definition: To call attention to the flaws of (someone) in either a playful, a taunting, or an insulting way.

synonyms: read aloud, read out, read out loud, speak

definitions.definition: The process of interpreting written language.
The process of interpreting a symbol, a sign or a measuring device.
A value indicated by a measuring device.
An event at which written material is read aloud.
An interpretation.
definitions.example: a reading of the current situation.

definitions.definition: Something to read; reading material.
The extent of what one has read.
definitions.example: He's a man of good reading.

definitions.definition: (legislature) One of several stages a bill passes through before becoming law.
A piece of literature or passage of scripture read aloud to an audience: readings from the Bible
